item.title: Comment on U.S: elevators are much more expensive by dan1111
item.description:
Reply to Peter:

I get the ambulance thing but the way that used to be accommodated was freight elevators. It so annoys me in modern US new condos they run all identical passenger elevators instead of installing one of them as a freight which accommodates both the stretcher need and tenants moving easily. THAT is how the should have regulated this, one mandatory freight if your building has at least two elevators.

Are tons of people dying in Switzerland because they can't fit stretchers in elevators? Let's see the data.

Regulations should be subject to a cost/benefit requirement, not just a "this sounds reasonable, I guess" requirement.
